website_summaries.verdict: Excellent full-color display screen. Locks onto satellites quickly and delivers accurate results.
pros: Comes preloaded with US and Canada topographic maps
Excellent to have an SD card slot for additional storage
Color display screen easy to see in sunlight and measures 3 inches
cons: Doesn't offer huge improvements over older Garmin models

customer_reviews.title: Garmin GPSMAP 66I
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great GPS/Sat Com device. Battery life is great! Userface could be better. Little on the expensive side. Make sure to pick up a screen protector before first use. The plastic screen scratches easily. Has great features and abilities! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Upstatemedic

customer_reviews.title: Birdeye View Sucks
customer_reviews.text: It's 2020 and Garmin still does not have satellite mapping imagery that Google had back in 2001. I bought this unit solely because it had Birdseye satellite imagery....but found out that it is so cumbersome and limited in capability it's practically useless. The images are limited to 5 sq/miles; have to be downloaded via wifi; trying to download multiple images to cover an area that is not your "current location" is absolutely a pain; downloading a 5 sq/mile image took 20 minutes over wifi and the image is only 82MB!!!! More than likely I will be sending this back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah R Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS for mapping
customer_reviews.text: This GPS unit is great, used for mapping out trails in heavily wooded area and it was spot on. Topo maps that are included with the ST model were very helpful. Easy to use model once you get used to navigating functions and settings. Typing is a little tedious but thats with any device using directional arrows and enter keys to type, the trick i found best is write down what you want for each track saved then type it later in the apps like Basecamp which is an awesome mapping tool. Seller had this unit out the door the same day to me in time for my project with no delays!!!
customer_reviews.author: Intrepidusa

customer_reviews.title: A GPS that doesn't lie
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, no software issues, great battery life. Ok user interface. inReach works great for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has it all...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, an amazingly accurate and full-featured GPS. Love knowing that I have the option to send out a distress signal when not in cell range. Takes a little while to get used to, so just read the manual and practice using all the features before going on your first true excursion
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Pass on Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this device. The altimeter is pathetic! Measuring at the same location on two different days, it reads 200 feet difference! Also, it doesn't record total altitude gain accurately. Doing a steady climb, AllTrails will show 600 feet altitude gain (accurate); this unit can show 3,000 feet gain. I suppose it would be more accurate if it is blue-tooth to my phone; then what is the point! Use AllTrails, it gives better information! I will not buy another Garmin product!
customer_reviews.author: David L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for geocashing.
customer_reviews.text: This is best handheld gps made by garmin. It is proaded except for the satellite communication. Great for hiking and getting lost in the woods. It has a very strong satellite reception. Garmin, if youre listening, you need to correct the steady gps wondering around. I used to own 2 etrex's series...it was simple to operate and it doesnt wonder around.
customer_reviews.author: Rica

customer_reviews.title: Not there yet
customer_reviews.text: In today's world with technology at the level that it is this garmin GPS is behind the time. Its not overly user-friendly and the satellite imagery is a waste of time. I was disappointed in its accuracy and ability to mark way points as I was moving. In order for it to accurately mark them I had to stop and wait. Garmin makes good products in comparison to other but the software needs a violent shove into the 21st century.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing experience all around
customer_reviews.text: Poor experience started during setup (pairing and updates). Stayed disappointing through disinterested customer service interactions. Still disappointing during use (have had better experiences with competing products, but sadly bought into this one now).
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Ugh!
customer_reviews.text: Garmin 66st is below expectations. 66st is a battery killer. If you keep the screen on, it looks like 66st is running out in less than five hours. And these days GPS is available as a good app on most smartphones. I don't konw why It is so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ki Un Kim

customer_reviews.title: Explore
customer_reviews.text: I ride Trails on my dirt bikes and Atv’s, and this tracks perfectly. It’s a great safety device when you’re out exploring. Highly recommended it!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Lee Fullen

customer_reviews.title: PRE-LOADED TOPO IS almost WORTHLESS BE READY TO SPEND AN ADDITIONAL $100.00!!!
customer_reviews.text: The pre-loaded topo maps are almost useless. Among other things they don't show trails or even fire roads.If you plan on using this for hiking or backpacking be prepaired to spend at least $100.00 more to get a decent map with even ONE SINGLE TRAIL ON IT.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Smurda

customer_reviews.title: One way coverage
customer_reviews.text: Very sporadic coverage. One way connections. Peopme can only respond to text you send.
customer_reviews.author: Jummers

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Unit works as advertised with in reach capability and checks easy to follow. Having to navigate screen with thumb control instead of touch screen feels very dated thus 4 of 5.
customer_reviews.author: ENorth

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded GPS Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I feel somewhat improved GPS accuracy than my predecessor GPSMAP64s and display resolution is good enough
customer_reviews.author: Byung-Gug Son

customer_reviews.title: Make sure that it is returnable.
customer_reviews.text: This product would not load maps as stated. Total frustration after 3 days trying to get it work. I have other Garmins that work great, but not this one. Returned.Make
customer_reviews.author: KHR

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Love my GPS. Now I can find remote locations easily, always know where I am at, and get back to the exact same location with the greatest of ease for fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Burke's Saw Dust Works

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, they have another model for offshore with nautical charts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good GPS
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Garmin's and this functions much like the others. The downloadable satellite pictures are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS!
customer_reviews.text: I have many Garmin GPSs and this is the best so far. Super fast satellite reception and the maps load fast too!
customer_reviews.author: Steven A Ward

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a learning curve and the maps may need some finagling to get the route you desire. But it's an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: charles shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Solid GPS device
customer_reviews.text: Been great so far still a lot learn about all of its options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, low end graphics!
customer_reviews.text: It works like you would want it too but the graphics do seem a little dated!
customer_reviews.author: The W clan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.text: Could not consistently pair with my iPhone. On one attempt it would pair, on another it would not. Not sure why. Tried to contact Garmin support and could never get through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great gps to take in dense forest
customer_reviews.text: only negative is it doesn't pair up to my android phone
customer_reviews.author: malau noye

customer_reviews.title: This gps will bring you home if it's really foggy or blowing snow/blizzard conditions
customer_reviews.text: Good gps but battery runs out kind of fast when using it on cold weather
customer_reviews.author: michael white

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS
customer_reviews.text: Do not read the negative reviews. I have no idea if they are correct or not, but software version 3.0 is on mine and the unit is flawless! It does everything right, screen is awesome, and all functions are great. Aquires Sat's in seconds. Is it different than the 60 series? of course. I love my 60 too. but it is light years advanced from there. And the bigger screen is super sharp and clear. I bought a 64 for 1 day because of the negative reviews of the 66. Hated it. sent it back for 66. Glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Software problem
customer_reviews.text: Useful layout,big screen,,, inReach working nice and reception,, but software has some bug.....
customer_reviews.author: James lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Step Up
customer_reviews.text: Nice step up from my GPSMAP66 62s. It’s ability to automatically download an ephemeris file via WiFi makes for quick sat acquisitions. I also like it’s ability to save RINEX logs that simplify post-processing for greater position accuracy, though this is not really a survey grade GPS. I don’t like that to wake up from screen sleep you have to press the power button on top, which can be a bit irksome in the best of circumstances and a real challenge with gloves on, since the button is stiff and barely rises from the surface.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, works ok
customer_reviews.text: Overall the unit is decent. The battery life is terrible however. With the tracking feature running I had around 3 hours of battery life before the unit shut down. To top it off, the unit did not store the tracking info before it shutdown because of low battery. Priced at $450, Garmin needs to step up their game. It is inexcusable to have software bugs and a substandard UI on such an expensive device. I wish they would make a unit of the same build without all the garbage "features" that this has.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Don’t rely on GPSMAP 66 to get you through long treks in the
customer_reviews.text: First impression - connection with Bluetooth went smooth, but showed connected in my gps. This is a serious learning curve interfacing with Garmin Connect, but it works. Bluetooth sucks up battery life. Extending battery life requires expedition mode and other energy saving settings recommended by Garmin. Birdseye server is not consistently available and you need a strong signal Birdseye imagery sucks! Garmin for those outside CONUS, we need another mapping system already loaded vs base camp and Birdseye I recommend Google Map for global use, the extra cost would be worth it vs the headache of loading maps from online sources onto the gps
customer_reviews.author: zipperzen

customer_reviews.title: Garmin gps and inreach in one
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is pricey but your getting a Garmin gps and an inreach in one. The previous in reach did not have the Garmin gps and that limited the maps you can add. I use this for trail riding and hiking so I wanted to be able to add custom maps and that was not gonna be possible with the previous inreach models. With this I added my own maps and it works. Garmin gps interface is reliable but it's old. I do feel like the interface could be a little more intuitive. Overall I recommend and I will update if anything new comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Connor

customer_reviews.title: High accuracy for Geocaching - great screen
customer_reviews.text: GPS used for geocaching. Replaced an aging Garmin E-trek 30 - only because the power button gave out. Comparing the two, you have to push a lot of buttons to get to where you want to go. The size of the screen is great and accuracy is pretty spot on. However, the battery life is far less than the E-trex thus the 2 star rating on that aspect. Overall a good GPS. Did not rate the Touch Screen since it does not come with one.
customer_reviews.author: JSB

customer_reviews.title: Get Lost... or not anymore.
customer_reviews.text: This GPS is great. Good piece of mind to have the SOS feature with subscription(which is reasonable to buy) and the ability to text when cell service is unavailable. Like being able to use the buttons with gloves on in colder weather. I never had any issue with the battery not lasting. I installed an OnX map card and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: User Product Review

customer_reviews.title: Will not boot!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful! This device booted once and seemed to do just fine navigating its features at home, but on our very first use (a test hike), it stopped booting up. The screen makes it to the Garmin logo but then flashes off, no matter the advice given at help sites from Garmin or gpscity.com. I am trying to get support from the seller or manufacturer, but they have not responded yet. Here's to hoping this lemon gets replaced or fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Robey

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen a lot of bad reviews about this product but apparent ppl don’t know how to use it bc it has worked great for me. It’s everything I ask for and more. I’m glad I didn’t settle for less just bc of some people’s bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: lance p.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic GPS with a ton of features
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned several Garmin GPS products for hiking/running and this one has the best menu system by far. I actually can navigate the different options without having to google what they are, and it’s simple/easy to get to the right page for the Satellites, Altimeter, Map, etc. I’m removing one star because although it has BirdsEye maps (satellite view), downloading the maps is sloooooow.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: This GPS unit is awesome for what I need it for. Make sure you update it before using. Make sure you understand the battery life. I use a solar battery bank to keep it charged in the field. Other units may have a longer life. But you need 2 of them to do what this one unit does.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good but I like the Garmin eTrex 30x over this.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product ok but I’m glad I purchased the eTrex 30x at the same time. I ended up going with the eTrex because it was the exact same software as this GPS minus some features I really didn’t care about. This might be great for some but for me the eTrex 30x and inReach Mini are the best backpacking and off grid solution.
customer_reviews.author: W. Design

customer_reviews.title: Display button is not bright
customer_reviews.text: Bottom push buttons are hard to see lit up during the night displaying their functions even on brightest setting.
customer_reviews.author: For Real

customer_reviews.title: Product support is just 1 call away...kind of!
customer_reviews.text: Needs a simple UI, step by step instructions in one location and throw in a touch screen. Call product support and save yourself some time.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and brought piece of mind to family knowing if something happened while hunting in mountains that I’d have ability to signal for emergency.
customer_reviews.author: James Ryan Brawley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get lost
customer_reviews.text: If you’re going to get an inexpensive satellite gos, this the best on the market right now.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Howard

customer_reviews.title: great gps
customer_reviews.text: gift for my husband Reliable in the woods when goeshunting
customer_reviews.author: Ilse B

customer_reviews.title: Great gps
customer_reviews.text: Touch screen works great the screen quality well was hard to see on a very sunny day
customer_reviews.author: Justin I Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Satellite locator
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet, looks great & seems to work well
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Cash

product_meta.title: Garmin GPSMAP 66st, Handheld Hiking GPS with 3” Color Display, Topo Maps And GPS/GLONASS/GALILEO Support (010-01918-10)
product_meta.description: Style:66st (Topo Maps)| Pattern Name:GPSNavigate your next outdoor adventure with the GPSMAP 66 Series. Whether you’re hiking, hunting, climbing, GEOCACHING, kayaking or mountain biking, you can explore more with this premium, rugged handheld with a 3” color display. It features access to birdseye satellite imagery subscription With direct-to-device downloads to help you find your way Plus preloaded topo Blues. And Canada maps on GPSMAP 66st. And it offers multi-GNSS support as well as wireless connectivity for active weather, direct downloads and Garmin explore compatibility.
feature_bullets: Premium GPS handheld with Birdseye Satellite Imagery subscription and TOPO maps
Large, 3” sunlight-readable color display for easy viewing. Display size - 1.5 W x 2.5 H inch (3.8 x 6.3 cm); 3 inch diag (7.6 cm)
Multiple Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS) support to track your travels in more challenging environments than GPS alone plus three-axis compass and barometric altimeter
Access to Birdseye Satellite Imagery with direct-to-device downloads and no annual subscription and preloaded TOPO U.S. and Canada maps
Expanded wireless connectivity supports Active Weather for up-to-date forecasts and animated weather radar and Geocaching Live for mobile syncing and updates

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars106 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Access to Birdseye Satellite Imagery, Documentation, Carabiner clip, GPSMAP 66st, USB Cable
